projects.title: Monkey Code - (Winners - Hackathon for Peace, Justice & Security 2018)
projects.description: Monkey Code won the first prize (€ 10,000) for its open source solution based on combining satellite data with recent social media data (e.g. relevant Twitter hashtags) to predict areas that are vulnerable for land grabbing. According to the jury, the challenge required redefining and selecting the right information sources first. This team worked on the Asser Institute challenge: how to prevent land grabbing.

projects.title: SlidesNearME- (Regional Winner- Netherlands "People's Choice"​) NASA Space Apps 2017
projects.description: We developed an interactive and easy to use mobile app that enables both citizens and disaster management teams to make informed decision before a suspected landslide event. Landslides are one of the common hazard in hilly terrains causing massive damage to life and property. We came up with an app “Slides NearME” that transforms landslide data into understandable information for everyone . The application combines observations send by the users, with NASA landslide data, to generate regularly updated landslide risk maps for an area. Thus, individuals and disaster managers will be better prepared to reduce landslide risk, and build a resilient community.

projects.title: SenseAIR- (Global Top 25 and Regional Winner- Netherlands "People's Choice"​) NASA Space Apps 2016
projects.description:
We4people are passionate about creating awareness in relation to air quality and health!
As a team, we came up with the solution SenseAIR, which transform existing data into easily understandable information for everyone by relating exposure to pollution and possible effects on health!
The application uses air quality information derived from NASA repository, that is linked with the users locations and movements in their daily life. In detail, the application integrates earth observation and in situ air quality data derived from NASA; links with user location and predicts associated health concerns. When a level of exposure is reached, the application informs the user about possible health risks.
Our idea adds value to bring closer of what has been developed so far. It empowers people to make decisions, which strengthens the basic human right to have a healthy life. Decisions as an individual, or a community member;which actively leads for better cities, better future

projects.title: Identification of suitable sites for the construction of artificial recharge structure in Neyveli, Cuddalore District, Tamil Nadu, India
projects.description: Ground water is an important renewable source and it is one of the basic elements in social and economic infrastructure. Due to extensive human activities, there was a decrease in the ground water table of Neyveli, India. The need to identify suitable sites to arrest and divert the north-west flowing rivers (Gadilam and Pennaiyar, Tamil Nadu) back into the Neyveli ground water basin for its optimal recharge was significant. Different layers such as geology, geomorphorlogy, soil, landuse, slope, drainage present in the study area were analyzed and combined using weighted overlay analysis to derive the suitable sites for the construction of artificial recharge structure.

profile_positions.description: “Identification of suitable sites for the construction of artificial recharge structures in Neyveli, Cuddalore district, Tamil Nadu“. The prime objective of this project is to arrest and divert the north-west flowing rivers (Gadilam and Pennaiyar, Tamil Nadu) back into the Neyveli ground water basin for its optimal recharge. I was responsible for the data collection regarding the soil types in the region and also the workflow development for the site suitability analysis.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description: Highways Research Station(HRS) was totally focused on Geographic Information System(GIS). Using GIS, I was trained to appraise the traffic density and the luminosity values of street lamps of Chennai City, India. I was provided with traffic data of various parts of Chennai city, with the help of this non-spatial data I created a spatial geodatabase which represented the geographic aspects of the data.
profile_positions.title: Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: Proud to be associated with an organization who helped a lot in providing basic services to the poor people. I was involved in a traffic awareness campaign, cleaning of a temple pond and engaging orphan children in extra-curricular activities.
